items.prompt: The monthly payment made to an insurance company is called a ________.
items.explanation: A premium is the amount of money an individual or business pays for an insurance policy.

items.prompt: When an accident occurs, the policyholder files a ________ to request compensation.
items.explanation: A claim is a formal request to an insurance company asking for a payment based on the terms of the insurance policy.

items.prompt: The risk of the new project ________ by the underwriting department.
items.explanation: Passive voice is used to show the process: 'is evaluated'.

items.prompt: An ________ is a professional who uses statistics to calculate insurance risks and premiums.
items.explanation: Actuaries analyze the financial costs of risk and uncertainty.

items.prompt: The ________ is the amount the insured must pay out of pocket before the insurance covers the rest.
items.explanation: A deductible (or excess) is the fixed amount you pay towards a claim.

items.prompt: Last year, thousands of claims ________ due to fraudulent activity.
Insurance ________ is the process of evaluating a risk to decide whether to provide coverage.
items.explanation: Underwriting involves assessing the eligibility of a customer to receive an insurance policy.

items.prompt: New policies ________ by the legal team every quarter.
The ________ is the person or entity that owns the insurance policy.
items.explanation: A policyholder is the person who pays the premium and owns the policy.

items.prompt: Third-party ________ insurance is mandatory for all drivers in this country.
items.explanation: Liability insurance protects against claims resulting from injuries and damage to people and/or property.
